wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Vivian Dacie, FRS (20 July 1912 Putney, London – 12 February 2005) was a British haematologist.

response: According to Sir John Vivian Dacie's textbook, Practical Haematology, "Amongst the Romanowsky stains now in use, Jenner's is the simplest and Giemsa's the most complex. Leishman's stain, which occupies an intermediate position, is still widely used in the routine staining."

response: | John Vivian Dacie||16/03/1967||20 July 1912 – 12 February 2005 Haemotologist, Royal Medical School, London
